DOC.brief_summary: The main objective of this trial is to compare the effectiveness of a newer supraglottic airway method (the i-Gel), compared to current airway management practice in out-of-hospital cardiac arrests treated by Norwegian ambulance services.
DOC.brief_title: I-Gel in Out-of-hospital Cardiac Arrest in Norway
DOC.criteria: Outofhospital cardiac arrest patients requiring and receiving advanced airway management on ambulance missions. Advanced airway management is defined as the attempted insertion of an airway adjunct (IGel, laryngeal tube or ETI) or the administration of ventilatory assistance/support (including bagmask ventilation (BMV) or other ventilatory support. Adult patients (> 18 years). Nonadult patients / minors (< 18 years). Traumatic cardiac arrest.
